content:
That's great to hear! It sounds like you're off to a fantastic start. Getting a core group of interested members together to discuss the details is a perfect way to kick off your book club. March is just around the corner, so you'll have plenty of time to finalize the plans and get everything in place.

Remember to keep the first meeting relaxed and informal. You can discuss things like:

* The book club's mission and focus
* The types of books you'll be reading (genres, authors, themes)
* The frequency and schedule of meetings
* The format of discussions (structured or free-flowing)
* How you'll choose books (voting, rotating picks, or a designated leader)
* Any other logistics (meeting location, snacks, etc.)

This will give everyone a chance to share their thoughts and ideas, and you can work together to create a book club that's enjoyable and fulfilling for everyone.

Also, don't forget to set up a system for communication, such as a Facebook group, WhatsApp chat, or email list, to keep everyone informed about upcoming meetings, book selections, and other important updates.

I'm excited for you and your friends! Starting a book club can be a wonderful way to build connections, discover new books, and explore different perspectives. If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask.
